intro: Gymneia interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted gymneia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Due to habitat loss, Gymneia interrupta is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
